body: Hello everybody, I'm a beginner on Ladybug. I have been practising Ladybug by watching all videos on Youtube. But there is a small problem showed up. When I was setting up point for textpoints, the points which were supposed to show up on the Rhino didn't show up and I thought It's probably because I didn't link sunvetors but, after I linked sunvectors to Sunlight Hours Analysis, the programme stopped working. I don't know how to solve this one. I'm currently using 0.0.62 ver and the lastest one of grasshopper. Thanks for reading :D [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MlwUY2Ci1enDMX012UFFQmQO3kkPreovkt4EiIQsVD8myBy1lHFRYOBCBjLEGyj6hsooOAiflrLjjGIWWeKyZyhWUdjdI1cD/file.JPG)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MlwUY2Ci1ek6OqrvFoKOaTubfkOShGJsdRdOwLKcBaTMHqVbJbgMNS1KCHDlYVsGe2vdcYYxbbyWpsjzM3M10k75yaxNyg0F/2.JPG)[](http://api.ning.com/files/1uifLWOMLze6J7j3Brl8vfXqqOsMdRbEXyUM334wKrZFyHTKFI4OOjXUw7RPI4-MznZcBpcDvxxylefLmXUrOSU2NPj8HU2l/file.JPG)

replies.body: it says floating parameter Pt failed to collect data.

Hi Misung, First of all a couple of information about LB components: if you see the inputs, you'll see some underscores on the right side, left side or both side of the words.
Left underscore: you need this to run the component
Right underscore: it is optional
On the both sides means: you need this but there is a default value inside, so if you don't connect a data, the component uses the default value as input. To run LB sunlight hours analysis you need _geometry, _disFromBase, _sunVectors, _runIt. Coming back to your issue, Have you set a Brep in Grasshopper? When a component or a parameter becomes orange there is a warning for you. I suggest you also take a look at example files on Hydrashare: [https://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/index.html](https://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/index.html) Best Antonello

Hello Antonello,



Thanks very much indeed for your kind comments.

I have set a brep in Grasshopper and linked every needed info(Geometry,gridsize,disfrombase,toggle). However, the problem is when I set a point component to testPts, it doesn't show up in Rhino model and when I changed Toggle False to True after linking every needed components even sunvectors, Programme stopped working and stuck.

Misung,



Could you attach your *.gh file? So I can check it.



Best 

Antonello

Antonello,



Thanks! I think It's because I set up mesh not surfaces. Is it correct?

I'm not sure about it.

Misung,   I don't think so,  Grasshopper  doesn't let you select a brep if it is a mesh. It seems like you have deleted breps without internalizing them. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS-fIm0y4pqaalKPCyhiRsuCl9BFK4wHM9ivf27U9J3SjQ3A6LHG*PSg5TXFiHb-9RPh*-YtLfLjQMBzQRkqJKWK/warning01.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS9FtaT8rWYnsEV*Dh4cVZaM8MValbyyD6It02YApxnuZ9UFkrUC9*9*rZmGqDZKLXMYmh2gHee5nlVKKTER-Aaa/warning02.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS*VHzhLyo6eX3cnhHuVGQmL3KWn3jkvCE3qGwfKmMisab7RfgNGJ5rKrTDpLCp*Ter2AV8d5bp9crlyY7Qq8KLf/warning03.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS9LN6AY9NNNyEt5tecjX1fZVJCop8ecVU43vtsyDtjY0l8OuogOsrFAM7re9LyIa6jkfhDTytLgrHaW*iIsbSS0/warning04.png)[
](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS9ykoQNtIOQ3srU*mPR6W-*tPv*I8-xmun5tTf*Adm97Euh4AhxnjZrI-AwFAVmrqggR0JRnwugouKsbW3W1RVI/warning01.png) If you connect a brep/or breps your file works fine. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/cLNDn7vrsS8vkU6vYyT6UGBpL2uFeyAOEgsXm8T19zX9zLNQvwvCoHCFoKEnI3UN0rKQlxJeUDoJVfhbCqON*EgpbcQ1*kb-/warning05.png) Best Antonello

Antonello,



I really appreciate your examples! Then I maybe set up too many breps which was over 40 buildings. I have figured out that if I make small numbers of buildings, It works fine. :D  Thank you very much



Best regrards

Minsung

I suggest to check the size of your grid. It is not about the number of breps.

-A.
Thanks very much! That was the main problem I think
